title: I AM A MIRACLE
content:
The central fact of our lives today is the absolute certainty that our Creator has entered into our hearts and lives in a way which is indeed miraculous. He has commenced to accomplish those things for us which we could never do by ourselves.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 25

This truly is a fact in my life today, and a real miracle. I always believed in God, but could never put that belief meaningfully into my life. Today, because of Alcoholics Anonymous, I now trust and rely on God, as I understand Him; I am sober today because of that! Learning to trust and rely on God was something I could never have done alone. I now believe in miracles because I am one!

title: MORNING COFFEE
content:
Every day is a day when we must carry the vision of God's will into all of our activities.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 85

When I sincerely began to ask God to help me to do His will, I had more peace and contentment than I had ever known. I began to see and understand that when I put my will aside, my problems became more manageable. Usually, my problems were of my own making, because I was trying to run the show. When I realized that I am not God, I became more humble and more open to His wondrous grace. My quiet times in the morning are for prayer, meditation and the practice of God-consciousness. The rest of my day is for carrying that vision into all of my activities.

title: THE KEY IS WILLINGNESS
content:
Once we have come to believe in a Power greater than ourselves, ceased fighting everything and everybody, and decided to rely upon God for guidance, we are on the right track.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 60

Having made a decision to turn my will and my life over to the care of God, as I understand Him, I find that the tasks that I face today are being handled. God is providing me with the strength and courage to do what is right. I am learning to not procrastinate, and to take action. This was not the case when I was drinking. My life was stagnated. My desire to drink was all-consuming. There was no room for God. There was no room for a happy and meaningful life. By being willing to have God in my life, I have been given the key to an adventurous life.

title: A NEW STATE OF CONSCIOUSNESS
content:
He has been granted a gift which amounts to a new state of consciousness and being.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 27

I have been given a new life, a life of meaning and purpose. I am a new person. I have been given a new chance. I have been given a new hope. I have been given a new beginning. I have been given a new understanding. I have been given a new strength. I have been given a new courage. I have been given a new peace. I have been given a new serenity. I have been given a new happiness. I have been given a new freedom. I have been given a new life.

title: A DAY AT A TIME
content:
Above all, take it one day at a time.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 86

I have been sober for a number of years, and I still take it one day at a time. I have to. I can't afford to think about the future, or I will get overwhelmed. I can't afford to think about the past, or I will get depressed. I have to stay in the present. I have to stay in the now. I have to stay in the day. I have to stay in the moment. I have to stay in the one day at a time. I have to stay in the one moment at a time. I have to stay in the now.

title: A SPIRITUAL AWAKENING
content:
Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these steps, we tried to carry this message to alcoholics, and to practice these principles in all our affairs.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 60

I had a spiritual awakening. It was not a burning bush experience, but it was a quiet, gentle, and peaceful experience. It was an experience of being loved and accepted for who I am. It was an experience of being forgiven. It was an experience of being given a second chance. It was an experience of being given a new life. It was an experience of being given a new hope. It was an experience of being given a new beginning. It was an experience of being given a new understanding. It was an experience of being given a new strength. I was at a turning point in my life. I was either going to get sober, or I was going to die. I was either going to live, or I was going to die. I was either going to be a free man, or I was going to be a slave. I was either going to be a man, or I was going to be a mouse. I was either going to be a winner, or I was going to be a loser. I was either going to be a success, or I was going to be a failure. I was either going to be a somebody, or I was going to be a nobody. I was either going to be a king, or I was going to be a pawn. I was either going to be a master of my fate, or I was going to be a victim of my fate. I was either going to be a captain of my soul, or I was going to be a slave of my soul. I was either going to be a master of my destiny, or I was going to be a victim of my destiny. I was either going to be a master of my life, or I was going to be a victim of my life. I was either going to be a master, or I was going to be a slave. I chose to be a master.

I have found a new way of being a sober being. I have found a new way of being a recovering alcoholic. I have found a new way of being a grateful alcoholic. content:
We are not saints. The point is, that we are willing to grow along spiritual lines.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 60

We are not saints. We are not perfect. We are not gods. We are human beings. We are alcoholics. We are addicts. We are sick people trying to get well. We are not bad people trying to get good. We are not sinners trying to become saints. We are not evil people trying to become good. We are not immoral people trying to become moral. We are not unspiritual people trying to become spiritual. My real purpose in life is to be of maximum service to God and the people about me. This is the purpose for which I was created. This is the purpose for which I was born. title: A SENSE OF BELONGING
content:
We have a sense of belonging.

ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS, p. 84

I have a sense of belonging. I belong to a fellowship of men and women who share their experience, strength, and hope with each other that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from alcoholism. The only requirement for membership is a desire to stop drinking. There are no dues or fees for A.A. membership; we are self-supporting through our own contributions. A.A. is not allied with any sect, denomination, politics, organization or institution; does not wish to engage in any controversy, neither endorses nor opposes any causes. Our primary purpose is to stay sober and help other alcoholics to achieve sobriety. I am a part of something greater than myself. I am a part of a 'we' program. I am a part of a spiritual program. I am a part of a program of recovery. I am a part of a program of action. I am a part of a program of love and service. I am a part of a program of miracles. I am a part of a program that works. I am a part of a program that saves lives. I am a part of a program that changes lives. I am a part of a program that transforms lives. I am a part of a program that gives lives meaning and purpose. I am a part of a program that gives lives hope. I am a part of a program that gives lives a future. I am a part of a program that gives lives a second chance. I am a part of a program that gives lives a new beginning. I am a part of a program that gives lives a new life.
